japanese: （海洋博公園内の見学を終えた俺たちは――）
translation: (After finishing our visit to Ocean Expo Park%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（最後に、美ら海水族館に入館して中を１周し、
　再び大水槽の前にやってきていた）
translation:
(Ultimately, we entered the Churaumi Aquarium, 
 took a lap around inside, then came back around 
 to the large tank.)

japanese:
どの展示も素晴らしかったですが、
やはりこの大水槽は格別ですね。
translation:
Every exhibit was fantastic,
but this large tank really is exceptional,
isn't it?

japanese: だな、ここの目玉なだけはある。
translation: Indeed, it's the highlight of this place.

japanese:
本当に、ずっと見ていられそうです。
色とりどりの魚や、マンタ……
そしてジンベエザメ……。
translation:
I could watch it forever.
The colorful fish, manta rays...
and the whale shark...

japanese:
そんなに気に入ったのか？
ずいぶんと見入ってるみたいだが。
translation:
Did you like it that much?
You seem completely absorbed in it all.

japanese:
これだけ大きな水槽の中でも、
一際、巨大な生き物ですからね。
目で追わずにはいられません。
translation:
Even in such a huge tank, 
the whale shark is especially massive.
I can't help but follow it with my eyes.

japanese: 確かに、迫力が段違いだからな。
translation: The impact is certainly on a different level.

japanese:
圧倒されるのはもちろんなのですが、
見ていると心が癒やされるんです。
なぜでしょう？
translation:
It certainly is overwhelming,
but watching it is also soothing to the soul.
I wonder why?

japanese: ……のんびり泳いでるから？
translation: ...Maybe because they swim so leisurely?

japanese:
ふふっ、かもしれませんね。
自分でも、どうしてお気に入りなのかわかりません。
translation:
Hehe, that could be it.
Even I don't know myself
why it's my favorite thing here.

japanese:
でも、１日くらいなら
見飽きることはなさそうです。
translation:
But I don't think I'd ever tire of watching it
all day long.

japanese: だったらカフェに陣取ってみるか？
translation:
If that's the case, should we go to 
the cafe and watch from there?

japanese:
ああ、大水槽の傍のカフェですか！
間近で眺めながら一息なんて素敵ですよね。
translation:
Yeah, the cafe next to the large tank!
It would be nice to take a break
while gazing at it up close.

japanese:
案内にあった、
お魚のラテアートも可愛らしかったです。
きっと一花も気に入ります。
translation:
The fish latte art that was in the guide
was also cute.
I'm sure Ichika would like it too.

japanese: 一花が？
translation: Ichika would?

japanese:
一花は、よくああいうものを写真に撮って
ＳＮＳにアップしてますから。
translation:
She often takes pictures of those kinds of things
and uploads them to social media.

japanese:
なんだその絵に描いたようなオシャレ行為は。
俺とは縁遠い世界だな。
translation:
What a trendy, stylish thing to do.
It's a world very far from my own.

japanese:
そんなこと言わずに、上杉君も少しくらいは
ＳＮＳの使い方を覚えたほうがいいと思いますよ？
translation:
Don't say that.
I think you should learn
how to use social media a little bit.

japanese: まあ、考えておく。
translation: Well, I'll consider it.

japanese:
もう、気のない返事ですね。
そんなことだから、四葉に
オシャレ下級者なんて言われてしまうんです。
translation:
What a half-hearted response.
That's why Yotsuba
calls you a fashion amateur.

japanese:
ぐっ……。
いや、あいつの言ってるオシャレは服のことだろ？
translation:
Ugh...
But she's talking about clothes, right?

japanese:
同じです。
自分に縁のないものだと決めつけているでしょう？
translation:
It's the same thing.
You're assuming it's something
you have no connection with.

japanese: ……言ってくれるな。
translation: ...Don't rub it in.

japanese:
ふふ！
あなたをやり込められるなんて、いい気分です。
translation: Teehee! It feels good to tease you like this.

japanese:
そういえば、この子、
ジンベエザメというからにはサメなのですよね？
translation:
By the way, since this creature
is called a whale shark,
it's a shark, right?

japanese:
そりゃあな。
急になんだよ、当たり前のことを。
translation:
Of course.
Why are you suddenly asking me something so obvious?

japanese: いえ、四葉がどういう反応をするかなと思いまして。
translation:
I was just thinking about Yotsuba's reaction
when she sees it.

japanese:
四葉はサメが出てくる映画が好きなのですが、
どれも、もっと獰猛というか……
ジンベエザメとは大分違うので。
translation:
She likes movies with sharks in them,
but they're usually more ferocious...
They're quite different from whale sharks.

japanese:
種類によるからな。
あっちにあった、サメ博士の部屋だったか？
あそこなら四葉も大喜びだろ。
translation:
It depends on the species.
Wasn't there a Dr. Shark's room over there?
Yotsuba would love it there.

japanese:
ずらっと並んでたサメの口の骨を見て興奮するのが
簡単に想像できる。
translation:
I can easily imagine her getting excited
seeing all the shark jawbones lined up there.

japanese: ええ、きっと大はしゃぎですよね。
translation: Yes, she would probably have a blast.

japanese:
子どもっぽいとは思うが、ああやって素直に
自分の好きなものへの気持ちを表せるのは、
四葉のいいところだ。
translation:
I do think it's childish, but it's one of
Yotsuba's good qualities that she can
honestly express her feelings towards things she likes.

japanese: ……ええ。
translation: ...Yeah.

japanese: ん？　どうした？
translation: Hm? What's wrong?

japanese:
いえ、好きなものと言えば、
三玖がイルカショーを見たがっていたんです。
それを思い出して。
translation:
No, when it comes to what we like,
Miku wanted to see the dolphin show.
I just remembered that.

japanese:
イルカショーか。
時間が合わなくて見れなかったが、
あれも良さそうだ。
translation:
The dolphin show?
We couldn't see it because of the timing,
but that looks good too.

japanese: 残念ですが、次の楽しみにとっておきましょう。
translation:
That's too bad,
but let's save it for the next time.

japanese:
そうだな。
またここに来る理由を残しておくか。
translation:
Right.
Leave it so we have a reason to come back here again.

japanese:
――あれ？
見てください上杉君。
あのカラフルな魚、見覚えがありませんか？
translation:
%p-2;――%p; Oh?
Look, Uesugi-kun.
Don't you recognize that colorful fish?

japanese: いや、俺は初めて見る魚だな。
translation: No, it's the first time I've seen it.

japanese:
そうですか？
どこかで見たことが――
translation:
Really?
I feel like I've seen it somewhere%p-2;――

japanese:
あっ！　思い出しました！
二乃がこんな服を持っています。
translation:
Oh! I remember now!
Nino has a dress like this.

japanese: 服かよ！
translation: Clothes?!

japanese:
なんだそれ、魚みたいな服ってことか？
想像できねぇ。
translation:
What is it, a dress that looks like a fish?
I can't imagine it.

japanese:
いえ、なんというか、
色やヒラヒラした感じがすごく似ているんです。
translation:
No, it's more like the color
and fluttering feeling are very similar.

japanese:
上杉君もひと目見れば
私の言っていることが理解できます！
translation:
Even you, Uesugi-kun, will understand what I'm saying
when you see it!

japanese:
じゃ、ここへ着てくればお揃いか。
ははは、想像すると面白いな。
translation:
Well, if she wore it here, she would match.
Hahaha, it's funny to imagine.

japanese:
いいかもしれません。
二乃に持ってきてもらいましょうか。
translation:
That might be nice.
Should we ask Nino to bring it?

japanese: 仲間だと思われたりしてな。
translation: They might think she's one of the fishes.

japanese:
きっとお魚にビックリされますね。
どうして仲間が水槽の外にいるのかって――
translation:
The fish will probably be surprised too,
wondering why their friend is outside the tank%p-2;――

japanese: なんだ、今度はどうした？
translation: What, what's wrong now?

japanese:
いえ、なんだか私たち、
みんなの話ばかりしています。
translation: No, it's just that we've only been talking about everyone else.

japanese:
……言われてみればそうだな。
意識してなかったが。
translation:
...I suppose that's true. 
I didn't realize it though.

japanese:
こういう会話は、世間一般では
きっと恋人らしいものではないのでしょうね。
translation:
This kind of conversation probably
doesn't seem like something
that lovers would have in the general public.

japanese:
だろうな。
けど、それでいいんじゃないか。
これが俺たちらしい形ってやつだろ。
translation:
Probably.
But isn't it okay?
This is our own unique way.

japanese: 私たちらしい形……。
translation: Our own unique way...

japanese:
お前は五つ子の１人なんだから、
あいつらの話をして当たり前だ。
translation:
You're one of the quintuplets,
so it's natural to talk about them.

japanese:
それに、あいつらの話をしてたって
俺の……その、恋人だってことは変わらない。
translation:
Besides, even if we talk about them,
that doesn't change the fact
that we're...um, lovers.

japanese:
は、はい、そうですね。
いまはそれでいいんだって思えます。
translation:
Y-yes, that's right.
I feel like it's okay for now.

japanese: 私たちらしく……。
translation: Our own unique way...

japanese: ん？
translation: Hm?

japanese: ちょっと四葉！　出すぎ！
translation: Wait, Yotsuba! You're showing too much!

japanese: リボンが見えちゃう！
translation: They're gonna see your ribbon!

japanese: あっ！　やばっ！
translation: Ah! Oh no!

japanese: あれって……。
translation: That's...

japanese: 五月ちゃん、こっち見てなかった？
translation: Was Itsuki-chan even looking this way?

japanese: バレちゃったかも。
translation: They might have seen it.

japanese: ……ふふっ！
translation: ...Teehee!

japanese:
上杉君。
そろそろ外へ出ましょうか。
translation:
Uesugi-kun.
Should we head outside now?

japanese:
いいのか？
時間に余裕はあるし、
もっとジンベエザメを見てても構わないぞ。
translation:
Is it okay?
We still have time,
and we can watch more whale sharks.

japanese:
そうしたい気持ちはありますが、
せっかくの沖縄旅行です。
他にも見たいものがたくさんあります。
translation:
I want to, but this is our Okinawa trip.
There are so many other things I want to see.

japanese: せっかく、２人の時間をもらえたんですから。
translation: We finally got some long-awaited time to ourselves.

japanese:
お、おう。
じゃあ、行くか。
translation:
O-okay.
Then, let's go.
